product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Great Tablet for kids
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2023
text: I purchase 2 for both of my boys. My youngest tablet worked great for about a month. Then out of nowhere, it wouldn't turn on. It was charged and even tried to factory reset it. It never turned back on. You would think I would give it 1 star because of this .. NOPE.I was out of policy and reached out to Amazon who then reach out to the seller. Because I was still under their policy.Within 10 mins, I was refunded and was able to order a new one and send the old one back. Customer service was AMAZING !!!!! I did purchase a warranty to make sure they are covered.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Great product and easy to use.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2023
text: Works just like the larger Samsung tablets which I also have purchased. I bought this one for my grandson who is four years old. I bought it about 14 months ago and it has been dropped, thrown and handled roughly and it still works perfectly and looks great. It charges fast and is long lasting. Be sure to purchase a protective case. The soft cases with handles works best for kids. I prefer the hard cases but be sure to get one that allows easy access to the volume controls Some of the hard cases completely seal over the volume controls making them hard to operate and can damage them. these tablets also have touch screen volume control. This tablet is also very fast.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Nice Tablet at a Great Price
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2023
text: This tablet is not slow, regardless of what some of the reviews say. Of course I don't use it for gaming. I use it for everyday things like browsing, texting, checking Mint Money, email, Netflix, etc. It is not *quite* as zippy as my iPad, but it also didn't cost $600. I was concerned about it slowing down when the Android update came around, but it just updated to Android 13 this morning and it's still plenty fast! I did disable as much of the Samsung bloatware as it would let me and uninstalled or hid the other apps I never use. I'm quite pleased with it. I had an old Tab A that was very slow when browsing and it was capped at Android 9. This one blows that Tab A out of the water and even has a larger, brighter screen. I may use this instead of replacing my iPad (which is having issues). I like the 8.7" screen. The iPad always seemed a bit big, but I wasn't ready to shell out $500 for a mini.Update 4/12/23: For those finding things to be a bit slow, make sure you turn OFF the RAM Plus "feature". It slows everything down. Go to settings->battery and device care->memory->RAM Plus-OFF. It really makes a lot of difference!

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Great Purchase
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2023
text: Why Buy On Amazon+ I bought this tablet because my outdated iPad mini two finally gave out on me. Anywhere I tried to purchase the device in-person over charged and required me to purchase another phone/internet line on their carrier or mine. Getting one here on Amazon, where I don't need to pay for all the extras over the course of 2-3 years and where I can enjoy it for my simple internet-based tasks just made sense (and was a lot cheaper).Usefulness- The battery life is nothing like an Apple counterpart, but it still holds a decent charge. Carry a battery pack and a charger cable, and you should be fine for the day.+ It connects to hot-spots well, so if you can use the internet on your phone or connect to wifi, then you should be capable of achieving access to the internet without needing to add a line with your carrier.I am very happy about the purchase.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Good quality to price
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2023
text: I have dropped this thing so many times but it still works very well. It's not good for extensive schoolwork but can be used for some. I got it to hold my digital textbooks and record my lectures as I took notes on my computer. Any app that works on your phone (Android only) works on the tablet. Really good for travel or for something just a little bit bigger than a phone (it is not very big). I use Bluetooth headphones and speakers almost exclusively and it connects so well. It also had a headphone jack. Its Wi-Fi connectivity was good. It even connects to my sketchy campus Wi-Fi. It has a long-lasting battery life (I could use it for 3 days before needing to charge it in most cases), though certain apps will drain it faster just like any other device.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Perfectly satisfactory tablet; terrible setup routine
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2023
text: The tablet is just fine. But the setup procedure is so frustrating that I almost sent it back. The problem is that after you go through the setup steps that you encounter when you first turn the device on--and the device tells you that you are all set--they download update after update in the background. If you try to download the app for which you bought the tablet--say, Kindle--the device just appears to hang. The same if you try to download a book to your Kindle. If you pull down the notifications panel you get a hint about what's going on, but nothing to suggest that the process is going to bring your device to its knees. It is this sneaky kind of bandwidth theft that I waists my time trying to figure out that really frustrates me. If they had just said, "Look, we have to download a bunch of updates. It will take about an hour. So just set the device aside and do something else until we finish," I would have been perfectly satisfied. It is the way they mislead you that is unacceptable. It's also unnecessary. Stupid!

I'm not using it for hours at a time but i have to charge it quite often.  The touch screen seems slow when I change the page. product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Great - for the price
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2023
options: Style: WiFi Tablet w/Cover | Color: Silver
text: I really like this tablet for what I paid for it (at the time it was on sale for $99) - it does everything I need.  HOWEVER - it's a bottom of the line product and there are a few places where it shows:Lagginess - booting up, installing apps, opening apps is slow.  However once the tablet settles down and has everything loaded, it runs fine.Touchscreen - a little bit of lag on the touchscreen too.Display- good enough but not incredibly sharp.  Pales compared to say an iPhone or a more expensive android phone.With that said the tablet was extremely inexpensive and is great for basic use.  Simple games, shows, web browsing all work well.  There is an actual headphone jack, which is great to have these days.  It's a good size and weight, not too large to be unwieldy but more comfortable for viewing than a phone.I think this tablet is an extremely good value despite its flaws.  I would buy it again for my needs and recommend it for anyone looking for something inexpensive for casual use.

title: Impressive  device for the money
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2023
text: For watching movies, controlling household systems, surfing the web, e-reading, and email, this little device, at this price point, is an astounding bargain. The build quality and screen clarity/brightness are well up to these tasks, and the 3Gb RAM, which sounds puny, actually handles them quite nicely. I happened to have a 32Gb microSD card lying around, so I popped that in and formatted it easily, thus doubling my storage capacity. Since I'm not downloading movies or installing games, a total 64Gb of storage should be all I need for the life of the product. I tend to replace these kinds of things every 2 or 3 years. WELL worth the money.

title: Amazing Tablet
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 24, 2022
text: I originally wanted to buy this at a Warehouse that starts with a ‚ÄúS‚Äô and rhymes with ‚ÄúRam‚Äôs Rub,‚Äù because they had it for $100. When I bought it and purchased it, I asked the dude at the electronic gate to pick up my item. He the directed me to the exit door to pick it up. Confused, I went to the guy scanning the receipt and told him what the ‚Äúsmart man‚Äù in the green vest told me. The dude also looked confused and contacted someone to help me out. After some back and forth, he told me the guy in the green vest (the same one who told me to go that way), would help me. I walked back to the gate and waited for the genius to show up. He then looked  up my item and saw that it was out and ‚Äúwould not sell me the display model,‚Äù as he sternly told me right after. He tried to sell me a different tablet (because he thinks he gets commission off up selling) and I told him that this tablet was the newest model (the other Samsung tablet came out in 2017) and I prefer that one. Ignoring what I said, he then explained to me ‚ÄúNext time you buy an electronic, you need to ask someone if they have it first.‚Äù Since there is no employee that works in electronics at this place, was I to bother a cashier or the lady who folds clothes? Or did I need to ask King Green Vest if I can partake of a tablet. I ordered my tablet from Amazon since when they tell you it is in stock, you do not need ‚Äúmake sure it is in stock.‚ÄùThat being said, the table is amazing. Display is nice, 1080p looks good on this small size. Battery lasts awhile, as most Samsung tablets do. The sensitivity may be not to my liking, but it could be due to the screen protector. But I would recommend this tablet for anyone who wants a smaller size and nothing too bulky. Since I have a Samsung phone, I could sync it up and receive texts and calls on it too.

title: Can't go wrong for the price.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2022
text: I buy these like most families buy bottled water.  You have to understand that I am a foster parent, and one of the things we do right away is get the new kiddos a small, simple tablet to help with anxiety.  We previously bought the Amazon fire tablets, but for the small price increase, you get a much much much better tablet with the Samsung.  The screens are bullet proof, battery is rock solid, runs an android os which means there is a wide variety of apps and controls available.  Our oldest one is going on 2 years and it gets used, and I mean used heavily.  The battery is still lasting more than 8 hours, the touch screen is worn in the heavy use areas but still working fine.  The cases are widely available and cheap.  I think the cases I buy for them are $10.00.  If you need one right away, the Amazon renewed service is great.  Those tablets are easily as good as the brand new ones and we haven't had any issues.  I purchased these brand new on a black friday deal for $98.00.  At that price, we stock up and get several.  We also run Google Family link and that control app is seamless between these tablets and my iPhone 13.  You just have to open a google email for the kids.  Couldn't be happier and will continue to purchase.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Great Tablet - Until I upgraded to Android 12
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2022
text: As a budget-oriented tablet, it's a great value for the money.  And it shipped with Android 11 where you could format an SD card to act as internal storage and you could move various apps to that SD card (thus allowing you to load more apps).  However, when I upgraded to Android 12, that ability was lost.  The SD card CANNOT be used as internal storage (but you can store pictures, documents, etc. on it).  Samsung is aware of the issue and but will not restore this ability.  As such, if you load a lot of apps on your tablet, this 32gb model may not suit you.  Just be aware of this.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: For the price, blame yourself for not purchasing!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 14, 2022
text: To be clear, I mainly use this tablet for recreational purposes (X-BOX gaming, Marvel comics reading and MLB watching). Nothing crazy. With that being said, it's definitely a steal of a product. Last tablet I knew that went for around 100 bucks was a bad joke! This one is a quality tablet for the tag though. Good picture quality. Speaker placed on the top and bottom so when in landscape mode, you get that surround sound feeling/effect. Don't get carried away though. They're still just tablet speakers. Lol. My only quarrel is that it has a tendency to lag upon certain actions like switching apps or pulling up the keyboard or typing the first 2 characters. There seems to be a slight delay. I would say about a ¬Ω to ¬æ of a second. Battery seems decent. Haven't really been able to dive into it as far as charging time and battery length. But it does hold a charge something serious though. I've been watching live baseball games all day and I only needed the charger twice for the day. All in all, not a perfect tablet but for the price, if you're in need of one, it would behoove you to pick this one up while you still can. ‚úåüèæUpdate:Battery life is VERY good but charging takes some time.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Would not activate
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 20, 2022
text: As tablets go, this is the normal Samsung quality and the main reason I purchased this and the reason for the three stars. The other two were knocked off because it won't activate on Verizon's service or a pay as you go service. That ain't good!I wanted a LTE tablet in my vehicle to run Maps and do the random Google search when required so I bought this as it wasn't too expensive and has a bigger screen than my phone. During setup when it came to activating the LTE service a message popped up saying that it couldn't be done and I traded out the SIM for bring your own tablet, pay as you go, one and it popped up a message saying it couldn't be activated on their service.... no bueno.I read other reviews that had the same information but figured I'd try my luck as I've been fairly successful in getting things to function when other couldn't. Trust the reviews, they ain't lying. The tablet itself is good and functions like it's supposed to but there are cheaper versions for a straight WIFI tablet than paying for a LTE one and then not being able to use it. I just said the heck with it and went to a Verizon store and bought the same tablet from them already activated. The model numbers between the two tablets are the same so that wasn't the issue. I didn't bother trying to call Verizon to get this tablet running on LTE, it just wasn't worth my time and I didn't have it to waste anyway.I did keep this tablet and use it for a E-Reader for work instead of my more expensive Tab S7 FE and it's a good little tablet... no complaints with that. The LTE connectivity is a different story though.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Great Tablet for a Toddler, but add a case
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2022
text: I bought this to replace a tablet I purchased on this site with the same name, and I have no regrets.  It's much fast and I spend a lot less time troubleshooting it or waiting for apps to load while my toddler loses his -mind-.  What sold me is the Samsung Kids app that you can install for free once you create a Samsung account.  So far that's the best contained environment I've been able to find for toddler level.  The included apps are simple and you can easily add more like Y...... Kids.  He loves it and it keeps a great charge.  Fyi, I was not paid or given any incentive to create this review.  I'm just a tech savvy stay-at-home-dad who likes to help other parents.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: (Update: Bug is fixed now) 32 GB crippled by Samsung‚Äôs Android 12 update
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2022
text: Update:  As of the OS update that dropped on 1/31/23, you can now move big apps that you don‚Äôt want to take up all of your internal storage to the SD card.  As I say below, this is absolutely vital for the 32GB version of this tablet.  This doesn‚Äôt change the fact that it‚Äôs generally a slower tablet than some of its similarly priced competitors, but the 32GB version of the tablet is no longer a hundred dollar paperweight if you need more than two or three apps.  I‚Äôd up the star rating a bit if the tablet wasn‚Äôt more expensive now than it was over the holidays.Original review below:This would be.a decent (if slow) entry level Android tablet but for the fact that Samsung‚Äôs update to Android 12 broke the ability to move apps to the SD card.  Since a lot of the 32GB is used up by the preinstalled software, this means you have very little room for adding apps.  You can still store media (movies, music, etc,) on the SD card, but you will still run out of space for apps almost immediately after getting the tablet.Avoid buying this tablet in the 32GB version until Samsung fixes this bug - if they ever do.The screen quality is not very good.  I‚Äôm not talking about the resolution (It‚Äôs low, but you can look at the resolution in the product description so it‚Äôs not a surprise), but I‚Äôve noticed uneven backlighting near the screen edges (which can be annoying watching movies or using dark mode in dark environments) on several samples of this Samsung tablet.  I haven‚Äôt seen these issues on competitor tablets even at the same price point, so this appears to be a Samsung thing.Sound quality from the two built-in speakers isn‚Äôt very good either - even with the supposed Dolby Atmos features enabled - but is okay for basic media watching.The tablet is pretty sluggish - probably partly from limited RAM (3 GB in the 32GB storage version) and partly a sluggish processor.  Don‚Äôt expect to be running newer games at full speed on this tablet, though older and less demanding games should be okay.Even the non-cellular versions of this tablet have a GPS which works pretty well, so you can use this tablet for offline mapping with various offline maps apps from the play store.  Came in handy for a recent Nevada trip.

title: Very Good Budget Tablet - Some Android Function disabled by Samsung
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2022
text: This is a good budget tablet.  I transitioned from an Lenovo M8 to this one.  My pro's and con's use the Levovo M8 for most comparisons and a 2016 Apple Ipad for one or two.Pro's1.  Faster than the Lenovo M8, slower than a 2016 Ipad 9.7 inch.  My most used application is Kindle and Kindle is much faster on the Samsung A7 Lite.  I also read the local paper on a tablet daily.  The A7 Lite turns pages very slowly.  Enough so that it's impractical for this use.  I use the Ipad for this.2.  Good selection of apps3.  Able to expand memory using an SD card and some applications can be moved to the SD card.  I have Kindle on the SD card and it performs well.Con's1.  Limited feature set.  Because this is a "budget" tablet it appears that Samsung has limited the functionality.  Many apps have limited permissions.  I happen to like the Nova launcher and it doesn't work on this tablet (Nova 7 does, the it keeps the Samsung "google" bar)2.  Not as fast as any Ipad.Summary - Good reasonably priced Android tablet.  Will replace a Kindle.  Limited functionality and applications.

title: Still exploring the product as I just received it. My first impression: I wish the product.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2021
text: Picked up two on the Treasure Truck for our kiddos to replace old 7" Samsung tablets. I honestly wasn't expecting much as a Tab A, but I really like these! They come automatically with 32g of storage, which is great when downloading a bunch of games and apps that hog storage. Add an SD card and you're golden for a while. In particular was a messaging app that allows us to video chat as a family of 4 - the tablets do not have a lag even with 4 on video at the same time and show a clear picture using the front facing camera. And the battery lasts for what seems like forever - the first day with a full charge, it was used for over 4 hours (per the parental app we also downloaded) with videos and games, and still had over half of the charge. And as far as the size, you wouldn't think going from a 7" screen to an 8" screen would really make a difference, but it really does. The colors are vivid and bright. I can't speak for the tech stuff, but as a daily tablet to run games and videos and surf the internet and video chat, this really is great. I'm going to return and purchase another for myself to replace an old Nook.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: 3 three tablets purchased all three tablets failed within a year...
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 23, 2023
text: I purchased two of these tablets a year ago and both "failed to turn on" literally one week after they were out of warranty. It seems as if it was almost designed to happen. Do to the crunch of needing these tablets for my day to day dealings I purchased a new one while I figured out what to do next with the two that failed. This newest one I purchased "failed to turn on" in UNDER A MONTH of receiving it!So, I sent all three in for service two weeks ago through Samsung. I was told that each one had to have the PBA-Main replaced, which is a power board/mother board according to the Samsung rep. Not only that but each one had physical damage. "Dented corners and scratches" which also led to their failures.I assure you, all of these units were pristine in condition. They were housed in protective cases and had screen protectors on each. The only activity they saw would be comparable to light office work. No adverse environments nor conditions. The kicker is the packaging I sent them in for repair was light years better then what I received them back in.https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B09NXW6K6V/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0922DRRBT/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1So longer story longer the newest tablet is under warranty and was repaired without charge but the rub to that is now the tablet has gone form a 1yr warranty to only a 30 day warranty since it has been serviced.The original two will cost $100 each to repair and will receive a 30 day warranty for only the repairs that are made.Moral of the story...the tablets accomplished what I needed to them to do for the time that they were operational. I'm disappointed that they failed and soon as they did and that the cost to repair them is only $20 dollars less than the purchase price of a brand new one that includes a warranty.Will I be buying a new replacement? NO. Will I have them repaired? Also, NO.Hopefully this review helps you in your decision. Buyer beware.

title: An OK second device
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 13, 2022
text: This is a nice little second screen for watching shows and reading news. The screen is nice and bright, the battery life is good. The audio is great, with good stereo channel separation due to its large size. I like the compact design too. However, I experienced some unexpected shortcomings:- The Android OS version installed appears to be limited in some ways- Using SD Card storage doesn't seem to be supported in app settings, as it is in other Android devices. Some apps allow you to configure the storage location in settings, and this is the only way to do it- Bluetooth connectivity seems a bit jenky. Simply turning on your bluetooth device doesn't connect it right away. You usually have to go into settings to do it.- Wifi connectivity is a bit jenky too.Generally a good device. I wouldn't advice using it for anything extremely important, but at this price it seems like an easy buy.

title: Does not compare well to Amazon Fire 8 HD
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 6, 2022
text: I own several Fire Tablets, both 10 inch and 8 inch. So my comments below are all in comparison to those. I felt I had to get a non-Fire tablet to use android apps not available for the Fire (in my case we travel a lot and most airline and cruise ship apps are not available for the Fire. I know there are Google work arounds which I did not want to do.-Even in a case, the Samsung table screen must be manually turned on each time you want to use it, unlike the Fires whose case turns the screen on and off when flipped open and shut.-Battery life is very low compared to that of the Fires.-Some apps, like the DuoLingo which I use a lot, work wonderfully well on the Fires, just as on my PC. However, on the Samsung tablet they do not work correctly all the time, and in fact force the user into additional purchases unless he pays money or "lose all the work done so far"-One nice thing about the Samsung tablet is at least the case I had fit and functioned properly. The case for my Fire HD 8 (not the HD10) is ""reversed". Hard to describe - look up reviews on the HD8 for details.

title: Beware of MSD card after Android 12 update
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 20, 2022
text: This is a brand new tablet.  Only had one day, set up unit and added a 32 gig MSD card for additonal storage. Prior to inserting MSD card, it updated to Android 12. Attempted to set MSD card as primary storeage location for pictures and a few other file formats.  Warning said destination is full. The card had been formated on the tablet and was empty. Tested card in other android devices, workded fine.  Testes other cards in the tablet, same results. After research, found several complaints regarding the same issue. Contacted Samsung, no help there. Day 2, I returned the tablet and purchased the 64 gig model as it will hold all I need to hold. Nice tablet, plenty of speed for everyday use but I wouldn't rely on the MSD card.

title: Excellent Tablet. Lives up to Samsungs reputation. Highly recommended
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2022
text: First off, this tablet is the perfect size for what I needed it for. The functionality is the same as any other Samsung smart phone or tables, as expected. Very well built and durable.Second, the negative reviews are BS and the reviewers don't know what they are talking about and obviously didn't do their research.One person claimed the you cannot format the Micro SD card. Yes, you absolutely can, just go to settings, battery and device care, storage, click on the vertical 3 dots, SD card and Format.This version DOES NOT have cell phone capabilities, but there is a slightly more expensive version that does, and has more internal memory and storage.As far as the speed of the apps, I have noticed no difference compared to my Samsung Galaxy S7. In other words, it's response time is very smooth a quick.Yes, this tablet is worth the money, just remember to buy a Micro SD card.

It is slightly slow but it is also Android 11 (Can update to 13) and you could put an SD card in it. It does have a headset Jack which is good also. I consider it a low end  tablet but due to the fact that it is the Samsung brand makes me feel it's stable. If you just want to watch videos and do a few things it's perfect. I have not tested it for games because that's not who I am but for streaming video you get hours and hours if you set the brightness to about 25%. I had no issue with the Wi-Fi or Bluetooth. I'm not sure if it's worth $160 which I believe is the regular price but it is a name brand so I would recommend it to anyone who just needs a basic tablet and you won't be disappointed.

title: Best bang for the buck you can ever get

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: A tech step backwards
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2021
text: I'm a huge Samsung fan, but this product was a huge disappointment. I was looking to upgrade my Samsung Tab S2, which has a 4:3 ratio screen and a sharp AMOLED display, with the A7.  Here are the issues:1. Screen. The screen is a dull, lifeless, non-sharp TFT display like you used to find in laptops.  The screen looks nothing like what you see on the website or on phones such as the S21.  The 16:9 ratio screen only provides for a 6x5 icon layout, which is not even as good as the Tab S2.  That means a lot of wasted space.  I also fail to see the value of the long narrow screen for anything but movies.  It is not good as a book reader.2.  Weight. The tablet feels bulky and heavy.3. No Samsung email app.  For some reason, the Samsung email app is not only not included, but is also not compatible with this device (and notwithstanding that it has been on prior tablets like the Tab S2 and on phones such as the S9 and S21).  This by itself made the device unaccpeable.  The Samsung email app easily interfaced with Exchange servers and other email providers such as Verizon.  Syncing Exchange contact and calendar folders via the Samsung email app meant that the native Android Contacts and Calenadar apps would be immediately populated with data.  No replacement email app will do that.I don't know the target audience for this product, but it is certainly not anyone looking for a high-performance small tablet with a great screen.

title: Beware of Androids 12 Upgrade - No apps on SD Card!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2022
text: When you buy this tablet it is a 32G tablet running Android 11 which lets you move apps to the SD card to make up for it's small storage.After you set it up, it will upgrade to Android 12 which DOES NOT SUPPORT MOVING APPS TO THE SD CARD!  This means that your tablet will be very undersized (storage wise).  Now days it takes from 64Mb to 128Mb to have a usable Android device.  So this tablet becomes very limited and obsolete  in how you can use it right after it is set up.

text: Super good value for such a nice tablet @ $120. Even at it regular price of $170 is still a decent deal. The battery is big and last a long while.Only reason I took one star away is the color balance. I knew the resolution was 1340 X 800. I was concerned with seeing the pixels. I am used to the sharp Nexus 7 Gen 2 that had 1900 X 1200 on a 7" screen. but the Tab A7 Lite looks just fine. You have to look very close to see the pixels.  What got me returning it is the color. It is heavily into the blue range. I put it side-by-side with all my other Android tablets, phones and a iPad mini and the blue just looks wrong.  I tried the build in color correction and it only got it even less natural. Tried some third party color adjustment apps. But I could calibrate manually and I gave up.

text: So I really was looking for a "small tablet" so it's easier to handle for primarily texting and checking email with light gaming with non graphic intensive gaming.This tablet can not even handle basic day to day tasks.  Even swiping between different screens was glitchy and not smooth at all. It was an eye sore to be honest with you.  Opening apps gave me the feeling of sitting in traffic. IT JUST TOOK FOREVER!. Also the touch screen I would have to tap 2 or 3 times before it would even register my tap.This is al because the processor in this tablet (MediaTek Helio P22) IS TRASH and extremely slow.  I returned this tablet after 3 days and just bought a Galaxy Tab S7 fe... I researched the different processors and the one in the S7 fe is 5 times as faster.It sad bcuz I really wanted a smaller tablet but it was not worth the "sitting and traffic" feeling it gave me.  When I tap something I want it to open ASAP.  Not tap and then I watch TV for a little bit until the app opens.  DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME on this tablet. You will regret it the 2nd you try and open the text messaging app.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: An excellent budget tablet
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2022
text: I'm using this as an e-reader for comics and manga, and it's really great for that. It's plenty fast enough for light workloads, has excellent battery, is lightweight and a great size, and has expandable storage. I've disabled most of the Samsung and Google services and it's very fast and responsive, and the fairly limited internal storage hasn't been an issue for my use case, particularly since I can store media files on a microSD card. If you're looking for a cheap lightweight tablet, this is honestly a really great option.My *one* major complaint is that the display resolution is really too low for the size, with very blurry text rendering particularly on serif fonts. For most content it works fine, and increasing the font size in epubs and such works fine to avoid this, but if you're going to use it to read fixed-layout PDFs or comics/manga with small text, it may be an issue.

title: Limited functionality
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2023
text: I have an old Tab E that I wanted to replace with this A7 Lite. The first thing I noticed was it was not as snappy as I'd hoped (I have an S22 phone). OK. But then I opened the Samsung My Files app and discovered that it cannot link to the cloud storage platforms of Google Drive and OneDrive. This is unlike the version on my phone AND my ancient Tab E. I googled this and found it is apparently by design. (Also, the version of My Files that runs on the A7 Lite is 12 while the one on the Tab E and my phone is 14.) That was it for me, back it went. No telling what other differences there are between the apps that are able to run on the A7 Lite and 'real' versions. Very disappointing. This is very misleading, I see nothing in the description of the A7 Lite that indicates it not able to run full featured versions of certain apps -- Samsung apps to boot!

Maybe 5 or 10 percent a day.The only remaining issue is the screen is noticeably dimmer when viewed at a 30 degree angle (laying flat in front of me). This was easily solved by purchasing a companion case/keyboard thing for about 30 bucks.Definitely an outstanding value !

text: I'm very happy with this tablet.  I put the micro sd card i had in my phone in here and upgraded the one in my phone.  It does allow apps to move to the SD card now.  Some reviews said you couldn't do that.  If this table had a little more RAM it would be amazing.  If you stay on top of cleaning cache and don't go crazy downloading apps it'll be fine.  I mostly use it to play wgt golf and browse Facebook.  It does great for both.  The resolution isn't great,  but for the price I think it fits the bill.  Get you one and see if you're looking for a budget tablet to play with.  I think you'll like it for the price and specs.  I also bought a nice case on here for it like an otterbox defender and it is really nice for only like $18.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Was good, then ‚Äúpoof‚Äù, an upgrade makes this tablet worthless‚Ä¶UPDATE
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 19, 2022
text: After working with at least three Samsung "technical agents", I was told that the SD card is a "known issue" and there was nothing that could be done about it at this time. I evaluated the use of this product without the use of the SD card and decided that it was useless.  Since the best they could do was offer me a higher priced product that would do what this was supposed to do, I decided that getting rid of it was my best option.  Frankly, the limitations created by not being able to use the SD card make this product pretty worthless, and the Amazon Kindle will work much better for much less money. So, I dumped this tab on the last day.  I will be looking at either the iPad Mini if I can get by with my one drive or the Surface pro from Microsoft if I need the SD. I would stay with Kindle, but the software limitations are super irritating and ridiculous.  Samsung really let me down on this one.This product was working well for me, and I was in the store by programs onto my SD card. Then android came along with an update and suddenly nothing worked. All of the programs that I put on my SD card became nonfunctional and I had to reinstall them. Further, I was no longer able to store any programs or memory from programs onto the SD card. That means, the SD card is useless to me. I contacted Samsung and talked to them and they have confirmed there is no update for this and the only thing I can do is take my tablet in and have the old software put back on it. That solves nothing as any time there‚Äôs an upgrade I don‚Äôt get the benefit of the upgrade and if I do I lose the ability of the SD card. So why provide a tablet with an SD card up to a terabyte if I can‚Äôt use it? Samsung tells me they‚Äôre aware of the problem but they‚Äôre not able to tell me of any plans to fix it.Of course, you can buy one of the more expensive tablets and you won‚Äôt be affected by this issue.

title: Best budget tablet for 2021 in my opinion.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 19, 2021
text: This tablet is a budget tablet. But with that being said, it offers quite a bang for the buck. 32 gb of internal storage. Which is important for apps. Expandable memory to up to 1 tb to store all your photos, movies, music and more. A good quality screen. A powerful processor, octa core 2.3 ghz runs games with very little to no lag. 3 gb of ram which is so much better than the usual 2 gb. The only drawbacks to this tablet is the screen although good is not as good as previous tablets in the series. But it's good enough. And there is no flash on the camera. I only liked that for the flashlight feature. This tablet has a hefty battery that will run for you all day without a charge. And one of the best things about this tablet is the dual stereo speakers on either side horizontal that makes movie watching like being at the theater. Get this tablet!

text: I bought this mainly for reading, but I also thought it would be nice to have something more capable than an e-reader. This tablet did not disappoint. The battery life is excellent, as is the screen. It boots quickly and the OS is not as ‚Äúbuggy‚Äù as is typical for Android. I have found myself using it for more than reading, including online shopping, email, general web browsing, and social media. My son likes to watch some of his children‚Äôs shows on it and the sound quality is great. Since its storage capacity is low, I bought an SD micro card to add more storage in the event I needed it. It is easy to move files between the internal storage and the card, so the low storage capacity doesn‚Äôt really matter in my case. All around, this is a nice smaller tablet in a world where large screens dominate. I highly recommend it.

text: Well picture quality was good for price but the screen needs to be a little brighter but also it was a budget tablet but heres were it gets bad so i tried to add it to my phone plan to get data on it cus tablets use alot more data i am tech savvy as far as android phones and tablets go so this was not a mistake or lack of knowledge on my part...the tablet had no spot for a nano sim card yes it had a sim tray but the nano sim card spot still had the plastic molding in the tray were it should of just been a squarish hollow frame that you place the sim card in n then put back in the tablet slot so i couldnt put a sim in it n heres the other problem that ive never seen it did not have an imei number under settings-about-imei number it said unknown so i dialed *#06# it said not supported when i dialed that i called samsung told the guy the problem an he never heard of this either cus he asked for the imei an he ended up hanging up on me 1 minute into our phone call i guess cus he new this was messed up so needless to say i could not put it on a data plan it wouldnt take a nano sim and there was not an imei anywhere in the tablet or even on the box where it also should of said the imei number so idk but that was my experience with it ---sent it back

title: Not as expected.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on May 12, 2022
text: I didn't think "Lite" meant slow, unresponsive, and 480p. Websites & apps load for an obnoxious amount of time or simply crash when bothered. Constant glitches in YouTube and other streaming apps. If you thought Disney+ was slow on the PS4, oh boy. The quality is so cheap compared to Samsung phones, which I LOVE. I see why all my coworkers have iPads.Now my real complaint is that I got this for light entertainment, sure. But mostly for work. I use Square for my business and this was supposed to make my life easier and safer because I wouldn't keep handing strangers my phone and I could keep my personal files/accounts and work files/accounts separate and on different devices. Unfortunately, this thing is so slow that I feel it's costing me money. It takes 5+ minutes to check out my clients when my phone took about 45 seconds. That's time I need to clear & disinfect my station before my next client. That's a whole military fade. That's a crying break in the bathroom after a 6+ hour color correction. I guess I just didn't expect a Samsung product to fall under "you get what you pay for". Unless none of these things bother you, just get the regular tab.

title: Slow, low-quality screen image.  SD card drawer easily damaged, rendering product unreturnable.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 13, 2022
text: This is the last Samsung product I will purchase.At least it wasn't expensive.  This tablet replaced my previous older Samsung lower-tier tablet whose battery died.  This new one has a worse screen than my 5 year old cheap one.  I can clearly see the pixels on the Tab A7, unlike my older one.It's also kind of slow to respond, which is pretty disappointing.  I wasn't expecting flag-ship tablet responsiveness, but I was hoping for something better with it's supposed 8 core processor.And to top it off, the SD card slot drawer seems intentionally designed to get damaged when installing a SD card.  I couldn't return this tablet if I wanted to because it's now damaged from trying to install the memory card.  The SD drawer is so flimsy that it seems intentional, possibly to preventing people returning this disappointing tablet.

title: Good kid tablet but defective camera
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2021
text: My 8 year old loves this tablet. She had the Amazon kids fire tablet for a few years but then I decided to get her a "big girl tablet" for her 8th birthday. She was limited with the fire tablet and I wanted her to be able to use her school learning apps on her tablet. I know it can be a little scary to give them a tablet with access to the entire Internet. However, the samsung is a good size tablet for her. The family link app is great and setting up all the parental controls on the tablet was easy. I speak with her about being safe on the Internet and I was able to set up the tablet to do things like request my approval before she can download things. Overall, I think it's a great tablet for a kid and would be great for an adult as well for basic use.Update: soon after purchasing this tablet we noticed the camera kept crashing. I would restart it and try other ways to fix but the app still crashes and the camera has pretty much not worked since we bought it. Very disappointing because she uses the camera to call her dad, family members and friends and it doesn't work. I didn't want to send it back after setting it all up and everything else has worked great.

text: We bought this tablet for my 8 year old son to use as a gaming tablet, reading and watching videos. This was 11/26/2021 and was a Christmas present. It wasn‚Äôt used until 12/26/21. On 1/30/2023 (Just over one year later) after the most recent update, the tablet is now completely bricked. It won‚Äôt turn on and won‚Äôt indicate a charge. We‚Äôve gone through all troubleshooting with Samsung. Since it‚Äôs out of the 1 year warranty period it will cost us $180 to fix per the Samsung tech. Nothing I can do about it other than write this review and hope you steer clear of Samsung altogether. We are a household full of Samsung tech including TV, Refrigerator, watch and 4 tablets. You should also note, Samsung began making it impossible to put anything other than media (videos/photos) on the external memory (SD Card). This makes the internal memory fill up with the apps/games and you can‚Äôt put them on the SD card to free up space. Altogether a miserable experience with this tablet. Do yourself a favor and move on.

title: THIS WAS NOT A NEW TABLET
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2022
text: Wve bought a NEW tablet EVERY YEAR for our nonverbal autistic son because he's rough with them.  He uses his tablet sun up to sun down which is why we don't mind buying a new one every year. The 2 times we did buy a REFURBISHED we ended up sending it back. Either the software had constant and incomplete updates or the battery life was nonexistent.We learned never to buy refurbished again.Not only did this tablet require almost 40 minutes of updates but it had fingerprints.The description on Amazon did NOT mention it was refurbished or used.This will be the last time we buy a tablet from either Samsung or Amazon.  It's Christmas day and I can't keep it from our son. We already threw out his old tablet this morning.  Try to reason with a nonverbal 13 y/o.  He wins every time but I can't help but feel he got cheated.  This seller should be reported for false advertising.

text: I was shocked to find out that this tablet has absolutely NO capability of output to TV or monitors. I was all set with my USB-C to HDMI adapter and Bluetooth keyboard just to realize it was a no go. It doesn't even have Screen Mirroring or Smart View. Literally no way to get the display on a bigger screen. Which is crazy because even the bottom of the barrel tablet I used for college in 2013 had the capability of throwing the display onto my monitor. I hadn't even considered that this highly rated tablet wasn't going to have this standard feature.Other than that, I did like it okay. I suggest getting the one with more memory or a micro SD considering a good chunk is taken up by system applications that cannot be removed. The battery life seemed good and it was easy to use. However, useless to me without being able to display on TV/monitor. Returned only a couple days after receiving it.

text: The device is not compatible with the Verizon network, as advertised. There doesn't seem to be a way to contact the seller directly, the support buttons just lead to Amazon support, and it simply leads to the return page. It's a brand new, sealed tablet with a preinstalled sim card that boots to a Verizon welcome screen, and yet can't connect to the Verizon network. Some seller support would be great.

options: Style: WiFi Tablet w/Cover | Color: Gray
text: In total, I bought 3 of these to use as a media remotes.  As of Feb 2023, this tablet is a garbage - due to Android 10 or 11 updates, this tablet is way too low on RAM and processing power to even view Youtube apps. product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Verizon says this is not a compatible tablet / Samsung won't register the warranty
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2022
text: Update: Tried to register the tablet's warranty at samsung.com. That failed with Samsung stating that the IMEI #, model code, and serial number were all invalid, so no US warranty after all! Nice to know this wasn't Verizon's fault either. However, as a last ditch effort, we took the tablet to a local Verizon store. As others have written, they tested the tablet with an activated SIM to confirm that the tablet was compatible, and then activated a new SIM out-of-band and then installed that in the tablet.This is for a Galaxy Tab A7 Lite tablet,  ASIN B0971TGSRJ that purchased new from amazon.com. Verizon says the SMT227UZAA module number printed on the box is a Verizon compatible tablet but the IMEI # on the box and on the tablet is not in Verizon's database and Verizon says it won't work on their network and they cannot activate the tablet. The model number displayed on the Android Settings->About page is SM-T227U without the ZAA suffix. We talked with Verizon several times and escalated the issue and even discussed the issue with a Verizon supervisor. He said most likely if we just return the tablet and order a replacement, we'll get one with a compatible IMEI.

title: Short battery life
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 24, 2022
text: Battery life is so short. I've spent more time charging it than actually using it. Drains 5 to 10 percent per day in sleep mode when I don't use it. If I use it with a browser or youtube it drains about 1 percent every two minutes. That give you about 200 minutes of use.I still use my 4 year old ipad about 3 hours a day and it only needs to be charged once a week. And it doesn't drain in sleep mode. In order to use the Samsung the same way I use my ipad I'd have to charge it everyday.Also screen is too bright at night even at lowest light settings. Volume in headphone jack is too low. These are not issues I have with my old ipad.

title: 60 days old and No longer functioning
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 20, 2022
text: I purchased this July 21st 2022 for my daughters 7th birthday. She's used it regularly, it's been in a case, etc. No abnormal wear/tear. It was charging and became so hot that the actual charging cable melted inside the tablet. We took it to a repair store thinking maybe they just need to remove the charging cable from the port. The repair store said the port got so hot that the actual cable is soldered to the inside of the tablet and they're unable to remove it. I'm outside of the 30 days for any exchanges. So it's basically a paperweight at this point. I'm glad it didn't burn our damn house down. Always a silver lining....

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Tab A7 Lite (SM-T220) vs Tab A 7 (SM-T500)
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 28, 2022
text: I have been using Samsung Tab A7 (SM-T500) for a few months.  I use it as a primary tablet when I am not on a desktop computer.  Tab A7 comes with 32G storage and it only allows a portion for user.  So, it went out of space very shortly.  I decided to replace Tab A7.Then I bought Tab A7 Lite (SM-T220) which also has 32G storage. But Samsung is generous to A7 Lite by giving more storage to user.  Out of 32G internal storage, the user can get more than half of it.In other words, A7 Lite is slightly better than A7 by having more user accessible internal storage.Just a note, some people can move apps to a SD card.  With Android 12 on A7 Lite, this does not seem to work for me.  I can't move apps to SD card with A7 Lite with Android 12, probably with access issues.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Clarifying Memory Usage
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 23, 2021
text: I don't own a Tab A7 Lite, but I do own a Tab A7 and Galaxy A12.  Both are running on Android 11 with the Samsung 3.1 GUIMy A12 has 32 GB Memory and only one relatively small app off loaded to SDMy A7 has 64 GB Memory and no apps off loaded to SDI used the Samsung Smart Switch app to copy my apps from the Tab A7 to the A12 so both devices have the same apps installed other than changes to apps between the two devices that Samsung made.The My Files App upon scanning came up with these resultsDevice  A12  A7OS Memory Usage GB  10.3  13.0Internal App Memory Usage GB  8.9  11.1Non System App Count***  105  105The Non System App Count includes a lot of Google and Samsung apps that can not be removed however many of which are very useful.  I have installed a bit over 40 appsThe Tab A7, A7 Lite and A12 are not gaming devices though you can intall and play some games on them.  If you are a serious mobile gamer I suggest looking someplace else as these devices won't keep you happy since their performance is not at a serious gamer level.However 32GB is good enough if you are not a gamer and are careful not to keep apps on the device you don't use  and are unistallable.  These are nice devices that are good for basic stuff including playing audio and video media.  They have above average audio.  You just need to be careful regarding your apps  including not keeping too many open at one time if you are using the 3 and 32 version .  I recommend running Battery and Device Care in Settings daily.  It optimizes performance.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: It's a dead tablet
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 17, 2022
text: I was enjoying the tablet for about a year.  I found a few problems - the most annoying was the inability to move apps from internal to external SD.  The capacity for 32 GB was pretty bad once you install streaming software like Netflix, HBO and Prime.  These apps will not work on the SD chip.  I read there's an off market app manager to move apps to the SD chip.  I don't know why Samsung hamstrings their internal drive.  I had all my photos and documents stored on my SD chip.I went to the Samsung website to try to find a fix for this tablet.  I have to mail it in for repairs. There are local repair shops in my home town.  The cost to analyze the tablet is $80 credited to repair. I went through the entire process to reboot and restart.  I followed all the advice Samsung offered.I contacted Samsung and went to Tacoma to get in line and have my tablet evaluated.  Their cost was $49 credited to repair as well.  After an initial look, they decided it would cast me $179 for a repair because the issue was neither the charge port or the battery.  It was the motherboard. The tablet is toast and now is a throw away.  I gave it to recycling.Later,  I ordered another that was 64GB. Then, I discovered it was a 64GB SD chip and a 32GB internal drive.  My new device is the same as the old one with a larger SD chip.I like what the tablet can do when it works.  It's a good size to use to travel and I like that it's only a wifi. It's a little better to read emails or kindle than on a cell phone.  My S21 cell phone does all the photos, texting and calls I want.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 28, 2022
text: I dislike that the navigation bar cannot be moved to the side of the screen where it would be easier for me to access when the tablet is held horizontally. The position can only be moved at the bottom of the screen.  The swipe direction on the opening 'swipe to open' screen cannot be reversed either making the swipe operation awkward for lefthanded users.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: The Good and the Bad
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 20, 2021
text: THE GOOD:It's the only Galaxy Tablet that's small and ideal for reading (like a paperback novel).  There is no competition other than Lenovo possibly that really competes unless you want to spend $$$ for an Ipad Mini.  Great with Amazon Kindle, and the Readly App ($9.99 a month for unlimited magazines, US/UK.So you get 3GB AND 32GB Storage.  Is it enough?  If you're buying it for games wellllll probably not.BREAKING NEWS!But just recently and by recently I'm talking as of September 2021, Samsung has sent an update to the A7 Lite which now enables you to switch APPS to your SD card.  (Their ad states this, so either they made good on their promise, or the lawyers finally worked out a copyright issue they had in the US).  I load maybe 4 to 6 games and still have plenty of space in addition to all my streaming.  It just takes a moment to make sure your storage (photos, music, docs (to MS Office's Cloud service One Drive), are off the actual unit.  A 64GB mini SD isn't that much maybe $20 and should be enough along with the cloud services you probably already use.Everything (other than the load time for Asphalt 9) works great.  I use this Tablet quite a bit for work.Case??  I don't use one.  If I was traveling with it, I might, but the whole deal with this tablet is how light and small it is.  Just my thing, if I break it, I got this for $129, I'm sure if it isn't, it'll be on sale again soon for the same price.  Battery lasts a long time and the charging is pretty quick, a few hours, it's not speedy but it works.  The case isn 't plastic like the Fire Tablets, it's metal/aluminum and the build quality like all Samsung devices is impeccable (I accidently sat on my Galaxy Flex A laptop and not a scratch).Sound: Great, better than my 5th gen Ipad, 2 speakers.  Being Deaf in one ear, allows for Mono audio, appreciated Android devs!Useful-Runs my Lights, temperature, automated household appliances.  Also works fantastic with my Fire TV as a remote (keyboard)THE BADPALM REJECTION-There is none.  You have to use your nubby bulbous pen straight and you can get used to it.  (I"m left handed so I'm not sure if right handed people would be more effected, I imagine it's the same).  I'm writing this review on my Samsung Galaxy Flex A Laptop which allows me to use a Surface Pro pen, I just wish Samsung would have allowed this via their Bluetooth connection on the A7 lite.  But I get it, they want you to buy the S series for $400 more.  Btw of which none are 8" tablets.I use this at work (information technology)  for note taking, it's small and portable to write quickly onto my one note (once I got used to the way I need to use the pen).SMUDGY FINGER PRINT MAGNET-Either get a solution of 2 drops of dishwasher fluid 1 part Alcohol and 2 parts water in a spray bottle, and a glass wipe (Dollar stores), or buy the portable lens wipes (Target has the good ones for about $3.99 USD).  You'll be using them a LOT!LOAD TIME FROM STARTUP-I don't mind that I have to wait for it to load, but when I wait for it to load and then go to enter my passcode and then have to wait for it to load AGAIN, that's just some software dev having a bad day and deciding to take it out on the user.OVERALLBad points aside I prefer this tablet over my Gen 5 Ipad.  Mine blown that this little light thing has 8 cores if you think about not too long ago dual core was pretty amazing engineering.

A 3.5 Jack for wired headsets, great for listening to music apps, I prefer this to Bluetooth headphones.5. It accepts a SD Card up to 1TB. I installed a 256gb with my music files, etc.6. With 32gb Internal, I just installed useful Playstore Apps and I still have about 13.5gb left. I didn't install any games.7. product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Almost great, but fundamentally flawed
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 3, 2021
text: At the time of this review, this tablet is listed for $129. Some reviews here are complaining about the screen, but the hardware is an excellent value for money. The screen may not be the highest resolution, but it's good enough for most media consumption uses and it is bright. The lower resolution will probably only affect you if you are reading relatively small text.  The build quality in total is very high for this price point. It's a thin, primarily metal, body that feels pretty solid in your hand.The problem with the tablet (and the reason I returned mine) comes down to a limitation put in place by Samsung's software. Samsung has acknowledged that the "US Variant" of their galaxy tablets do not allow formatting SD cards as internal storage or moving apps to external storage. This means that your app storage is limited by the built-in device storage. This tablet has 32GB of storage, but about 15 of that is taken by the system and you are left with only 17. This simply is not enough space for apps on a tablet bought in 2021.To be clear, this is not an android limitation or an app limitation, it is a limitation put in place by Samsung.  If you look around online you will find advice from people (who presumably don't own this tablet) telling you how to move some android apps to an SD card, but that advice does not apply on this device. Even if the app developer has explicitly enabled the ability to move an app to external storage and even if you have moved the same app on another android device, it will not work here. Not even enabling developer options or trying to use ADB to move apps will resolve this problem.There is a 64GB version of this tablet available from Samsung that is currently bouncing back and forth between a list price of $199 and sale price of $149. If you are considering this tablet, I would highly recommend spending the extra $20 and getting the higher model It has twice as much storage, but since the system reserved space doens't change, you effectively go from 17gb for apps to 49gb for apps. This is much more workable given the SD card limitations.

text: I have the Galaxy Tab A7 10.4 inch 32gb which I love but it's a bit bulky and heavy to read for hours on end so I started looking for a smaller tablet... my parents recommended the 8inch Kindle fire tablet but it won't cast to chromecast as it's not Android and won't support Google play which is where I get the nook app to read all of my books, and it won't add the nook app to its store bc it wants you to buy Kindle books,  so nope. I used to have a nook tablet but the old ones can't keep up with the new versions of apps and the new nooks break super easy and need to be replaced every year or two and I wasnt super impressed with the new/current Lenovo nook tablet or its reviews.... tho one good thing about nooks is that they allow you to add the competitors apps on it like kindle, audible, and prime video... however I just didn't like the Lenovo nook,  Samsung nook was way better,  so nope....So I hunted around and saw this and even tho this didn't have a ton of reviews I decided to give it a try seeing as how I have the larger version and really like how well it works. I was initially hesitant bc at $159 it wasn't that much cheaper than the 10.4 inch version I bought,  however when it went on sale down to $129 I was really happy! I've had it a few days now and I really love it.  It's just like the bigger version, very fast, easy to setup and use. Battery life is great! The size is perfect for reading, tho it's still a bit heavier than I'd like but I bought a Fintie case to prop it up so I think that will help a lot.I really researched and hunted for almost 3 months and honestly this is the best 8inch 32gb android system tablet I found and after using it for a few days now I can say I'm definitely very happy with it and highly recommend it!!!

title: Verizon does not accept these
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 12, 2022
text: I took me 3 days of calls to Verizon customer service and one visit to a Verizon Store to activate my device in their network. None could help me. They only check if the EMEI number that identifies the device is in their database to determine if it is compatible with the Verizon network.Well, seems that the EMEI is not in their database, so they declared the tablet as "incompatible" with their network. Even I demonstrated that the tablet is getting signal and that inserting an activated Verizon SIM makes the tablet to work.In the verizon store they even suggested to return the tablet to amazon and buy it directly from them to make sure it is compatible. I suspect that not only the devices are locked to prevent using them in other mobile networks but they make it difficult for a consumer to buy a device from another retailer.At the end a customer support representative did some trick to activate a SIM to make it work. However the device is not listed as a Samsung Galaxy Tab in my verizon account. Will see if that could carry any issue in the future!

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Not bad, but Samsung seems to be removing features....
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 1, 2022
text: This is a bit of nitpick, but I suspect others have questions about this, so I think I'm doing a bit of public service by pointing this out (if I'm wrong, I hope someone points this out).1.  Overall, the quality of the tablet is quite good, given the price point.  It is probably the best of the "budget" tablets, but it is also more expensive than its competitors (thinking mostly of Lenovo M8), so I guess that's fairly even.2.  One particularly disappointing feature is that the "smart view" functionality seems to have been discontinued.  There used to be an icon called "Smart view" in older Samsung tablets that enabled screen mirroring via Miracast.  Not sure if it's gone from Samsung tablets across the board or just from budget models, but, while, apparently A7 Lite used to have this feature, it is no longer present (at least) in the current version.  No "obvious" means of mirroring screen now, and it might be the way of the future, alas.#2 is not a dealbreaker for me since Miracast still works on Windows machines (and an older Samsung tablet) and I'm perfectly happy with what this tablet was bought for.  But that it has disappeared and that a lot of (apparently) outdated websites that "helpfully" show how to use this functionality are still around providing misleading information is a bit disappointing.  If a major corporation like Samsung does away with what I gather was a very popular feature, it should make sure that people know if the functionality has been removed.Edit:  Samsung tech who answered my phone call was insistent that the screen mirroring feature is still there and, if the feature does not show up after updating everything (and doing a factory reset and updating everything), that means something is wrong and that I should return it for replacement.  It didn't show up after updating everything, then doing a factory reset then updating everything.  So I am doing exactly that and will report back if the situation changes when the replacement device comes in.Edit #2:  The replacement device came in, but exactly the same problem.  Repeated the same process as I was told by the tech the other day, and still the same thing.  Called Samsung again, and another tech tells me that the previous tech was wrong and that the feature indeed has been discontinued for all Samsung tablets (i.e. only phones now have that feature).  A lot of contradictory information out there, including from Samsung techs themselves over past 48-72 hours.  So it seems that the final word is that there is no screen mirroring capability on Samsung tablets any more, cheap or expensive, it seems.  Samsung really needs to get the story straightened out!  Like I mentioned in the first version of the review, screen mirroring is not a feature that is essential to me, so it's not a deal breaker by itself, but it is convenient enough feature for me that not having it is really disappointing.  It seems that Samsung is not what it used to be if its own tech support ppl don't seem to know what's really going on with their products.  (I'd figure that screen mirroring is popular enough feature that people will want to know about this! :( )

Battery life was terrible, every bug fix came with 20 more bugs!  I  can't believe that Samsung could even build anything this badlymade!  I am reduced to using my Samsung Galaxy s9plus phone that I can barely see and after 2 years even that has serious problems charging!  As far as I'm concerned Samsung has gone down hill since their Samsung galaxy first phones.  I even hate my Samsung 40 inch TV that cost me almost $500 and has had nothing but problems!  I can not recommend Samsung for anything!

title: Samsung A7 lite is good for apps that Kindle doesn't support
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2022
text: I love Kindles, but this Samsung A7 lite tablet will be good for laptop-free trips where I can download and use more apps.  Funny how Kindle won't let you use some apps and the Samsung kindle app isn't all that great, but if you have two tablets (still less hassle than a laptop on a trip) much can be done.  I have a Samsung phone, so sharing it's apps was a plus for me.  Was hoping to save money by checking out books from my local library on this Samsung, but my library's ebook selection turned out to be limited.  You can't load this A7 up with apps or photos since the storage is good, but not huge.

title: Should have read the fine print, if there was any.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 3, 2022
text: So this is a nice enough tablet very light weight, very bright and nice visuals, however something wasn't working right and I couldn't figure out what it was. So I did some Google research and found out that this tablet was not made to be used with a stylus. What?!?  You've got to be kidding. Who doesn't use a stylus these days? Maybe a six-year-old.  Even so, they should be able to. So unless you want to constantly be touching the screen with your finger forget about this tablet. Would be nice if they gave you this piece of information in the description. It might eliminate returns and unhappy customers.  I have been a loyal Samsung customer, but currently they do not have a tablet that suits my needs.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Best low-cost Android tablet for the price
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 18, 2022
text: I had been looking for an inexpensive Android-based tablet for a while now, mainly to use specific Android-only apps for external devices. Mind you, I have already tried a few cheap Android tablets already, some from no-name brands and some from well-known brands... all of which I immediately returned after such a horrible experience. Basically anything available under $100 is such a compromise - these tablets are usually made from all plastic, with a super slow chip, a mediocre touch screen, economy-build quality, and a slow and unresponsive operating system. In other words, the literal definition of CHEAP.However, the Galaxy Tab A7 Lite is none of those; for a little over $100 you get a much better experience overall! The build quality is nice, the aluminum body doesn't look or feel tacky, the touch screen is pretty responsive, and you get a smooth Android experience. Even if this is Samsung's lowest-priced tablet, it is a capable performer and a pretty good value. While it doesn't have 4k HDR and isn't powerful enough to play many AAA games, that isn't what I bought it for and that isn't what it was meant to do. I needed a simple, capable Android tablet and I found what I was looking for here; This is the difference between being "cheap" and being "low-cost"!When there are deals (which is often) you can pick up the Tab A7 Lite for about $100-110. I can confidently say that the Galaxy Tab A7 Lite is the best bang-for-the-buck low-cost (not "cheap") Android tablet available!

text: Im an Apple deserter. The new ipad Mini? 128 gb: 500 clams! They can take a long walk off a short pier! My current iPad mini has been a trooper, but I see longer charging times, lag has been noticeable and the time has come for a step way down to an android playground. Little did I know how satisfied I would be with this in-animate device! I thought only a human could make me feel so good. I immediately installed a 128 GB sdxc card and uploaded 1,172 of my favorite songs, 2000+/- photos, and tried to upload a dollop of 4K videos which it would not play. (it only plays HD 1080 videos) I downloaded Samsung audio player from the Samsung store and my music is awesome! Full, Rich, and powerful. The player does not support microsoft windows .wma files! (shame on windows) Conclusion: An excellent replacement for Apples greedy (no card expansions) product restrictions.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: Surprisingly good, although perhaps not worth it at full price
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2022
text: For context, I purchased this tablet on sale for $109.00. Additionally, I have been using Samsung Galaxy S series phones for a decade, previously used a Samsung tablet from about 2013-2015, and currently use both a Fire HD 8 (2020 model) tablet and a Fire 7 (2019 model) tablet. Finally, I purchased this because I needed a tablet with access to Google Play Services for a specific set of purposes.First of all, it's important to keep in mind that the Galaxy A series is Samsung's "budget" line of tablets and smartphones, and this is the cheapest of their tablets. The performance is not going to be as good as the flagship Series S or Series Z devices; if you have, for example, an S22 as your phone, you should not expect the performance of this tablet, the screen, etc to match that. It also is not going to meet the specs and quality of iPads, Surfaces, or other high-end tablets. That being said, Android tablets overall are much better quality than they were several years ago, which my experience with this tablet has confirmed for me.The screen is good--much better than I expected. Everything is clear and sharp, and there's basically no pixilation. It does have a lower pixel density than a lot of other devices, but more than most budget Android tablets. The screen can also be slightly difficult to view from certain angles, although that shouldn't be an issue for 99% of use cases; it can also be a bit difficult to see in brighter lights. In terms of physical qualities, it's basically the same as the screen on my S21.The sound is also better than I expected. It doesn't seem to carry as far as other devices--once again, not a huge issue--but it's loud and clear. The fact that there's an audio jack is appreciated, and one can always connect a speaker or headphones via bluetooth.The extra 1GB of RAM compared to my Fire HD 8 is definitely noticeable in most cases, although this is still not what I would call a speedy device. If you're just watching video, listening to audio, and reading, this will be irrelevant to you outside of saving a second or so when you open an app, pull up the keyboard, or turn on the tablet. I have not played any games on it, but I assume that more demanding ones would have some noticeable difficulties on this.Battery life seems great so far. The tablet supports fast charging, but the included charger does not.The tablet is lightweight, although compared to my Fire HD 8, it is not as comfortable to hold. The materials used are also very nice, and it doesn't look or feel like a budget tablet. It's small enough that fitting it into most bags or purses shouldn't be difficult. The fact that storage is also expandable up to 1 TB is appreciated. The charging port is USB-C, which is basically standard nowadays, although many budget devices still use micro-USB, so it's worth mentioning.The cameras are adequate, and are fine for Zoom, Skype, and other video sites. I have not used the microphone, but I assume it's also serviceable.There are seemingly some interesting options to connect this to a Samsung phone, although I am not using those. Still, this could be a nice option for some people.Unfortunately, there do not seem to be very many good cases available for this model. There do appear to be a lot of "heavy-duty" cases for it though, which is nice if you're purchasing this for a young child.Overall, if you can get this on sale--especially if you *have* to have access to Google Play Services or otherwise can't or don't want to use Fire OS--this is definitely a great choice for a tablet. It will get updates and remain usable for far longer than similarly-priced and cheaper Android tablets from Onn, Chinese manufacturers using the names of old American brands, and the like. That being said, if you're primarily looking for a device for consuming content--which is what the overwhelming majority of people use tablets for--I'd still recommend the Fire HD 8, especially during one of the many times per year that it goes on sale, as I don't feel that the differences are worth the extra $50.00-$110.00 the A7 Lite will cost. Still, this is probably the best inexpensive Android tablet on the market today, and is a fantastic option to consider if you're looking to purchase one.
