title: can replace cell phone for most (not all) functions.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 19, 2022
text: I bought this to use for reading books. Period. Wasn't planning to use it for anything else. After two days, I find myself using it for almost everything, including texts and phone calls (I have a Samsung A52 phone, so I can "mirror" calls and texts with the tablet). I am 63, and my eyes and fingers don't work as well as they did even a year ago, so I guess the increased size of this device makes a significant difference. I've also decided to redo my music collection in a non-lossy format (flac) so it takes up a good bit more room than mp3 or vorbis, but the music quality is noticeably better (at least to my ears) and if I need more space I can buy a bigger sd card. I thought maybe I should have bought the version that includes cell phone functionality, but I'm glad I didn't. I'll still use my cell when in the car or riding my bicycle for music. For calls using the tablet I either use speakerphone or a bluetooth headset or earbuds. Having both devices increases flexibility. VERY glad I bought this, I should have bought one years ago! Oh, and yes, I use it to read books too, it's great for that!

title: For $109.00, This Is A No-Brainer!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2022
text: Initially I purchased Kindle Fire 7" (2022), and it costs $94.99 (32 GB, Without Lockscreen Ads), and it was not a good experience. It only has 2GB RAM,  its resolution was really low to enjoy any kind of media (movies, YouTube, etc), and it is closed to Amazon eco-system. Sure you could add Play Store to download Google apps, but it takes downloading and installing APK files. And I do not want to go through the hassle. So I returned it. Then I noticed by chance that Galaxy Tab A7 Lite was on sale for $109.00, so I jumped on it! For $15.00 more than Fire 7" - this is an excellent value! It comes with 3GB RAM, better processor, and better screen resolution to enjoy your media consumption. Better build and no restrictions to Google apps, this is a great little tablet you could take anywhere! I love it! Recommended!

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A7 Lite 8.7" 32GB WiFi Android Tablet w/ Long Lasting Battery, Compact, Slim Design, Sturdy Metal Frame, US VersonGray
title: A Samsung Galaxy Tab RAVE, from a tough reviewer.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 28, 2022
text: I have had a Samsung tablet since 2015 that I have used every single night (black in the photo, white is new one), sometimes for several hours before bed. It has been BY FAR the best performing electronic device I've ever owned. So when it came time to buy a second tablet for work purposes, I navigated back to Samsung Tabs. After debating the choices for GB size, screen size, and optional pen use in the family of Tabs, I decided on this one. I choose it because while I need performance with office apps, social media, and other apps, I don't need it for heavy graphics use, as in heavy graphics gaming. But as it turns out, it works with hardcore photo editing apps like a champ, no hesitation in speed or performance at all. And the price? There's a lot of value for the money here.What I think: I've had this a month and it's a performance superstar, just like the old one. One giant plus is that you take it out of the box and turn it on, it's already charged so you're good to go within minutes. Set up is so easy that any novice could do it. Wifi connectively is seamless, performance is smooth, takes gorgeous photos, screen colors are rich and crisp, screen refresh is on point, the size is portable, fits a huge variety of tablet covers, holds a charge, Android system assures access across all devices, and the sound quality is very good.  My experience is that Samsung designs "forward" for the needs of the everyday consumer (me) which ensures that their devices perform reliably day after day despite the increasing demands of ever-evolving uses. Some devices are designed to obsolete as soon as you open them, but that is just not the case here.I'll always mention any downsides of any product, but I have yet to find a single flaw with this tablet. Just like the last one, I look forward to having it for a long time to come. Highly recommend.
